What is the main difference between a wireless access point and a hub?
questions.correct_answer: An access point simply provides a secondary location of the network for devices to connect from, increasing the capacity of the network. A hub sets up a local network to manage the devices on the network. Wireless access points need to have an extra step that hubs don't have. Before a computer can submit data, it needs to send a request to send message (RTS). Wireless access points are wireless, and hubs are wired.

questions.correct_answer: Both turn private IP addresses into public IP addresses. NAT does this by turning local addresses to global addresses, while PAT does this by translating unregistered IP addresses to registered public IP addresses.
